content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="f of 3, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f prime of 3, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="g of x, equals, x squared, times f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
